titles.title: Foreign Aid Impact Assessment Act
To require periodic assessments of the impact and effectiveness of United States economic assistance to foreign countries.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.summary: 5/25/1993--Introduced. Foreign Aid Impact Assessment Act - Requires the President to submit triennially to the Congress a report (on a country-by-country basis) analyzing the impact and effectiveness of U.S. economic assistance provided during the preceding three fiscal years. Requires that each report: (1) be submitted to the Congress as a separate document; and (2) identify those countries in which economic assistance has been most and least successful, explain why the assistance was not more successful, and specify what the United States has done as a result.
